content: I'm in a professional development course, and I volunteered to find (mathematical) programming jobs/opportunities. Does anyone have suggestions of how to look for these?
Well, there are roles like data scientist and quantitative analyst where the math is part of the job description.

Functional programming and formal methods are two more specialized areas of 'mathematical programming,' but I gather to find those jobs it is more about knowing specifically which companies to look at:
Draper, Galois, Statebox, Sunshine Cybernetics etc. Perhaps there is a good aggregate or just searching those terms on some of those jobs sties. Mike probably knows his way around the blockchain/smart contracts land.
https://galois.com/ That's a nice front page. @Blake Pollard do you know people there?

For Sunshine Cybernetics, their proof language Formality seems to have an associated diagram calculus. https://github.com/moonad/Formality Or maybe it's just a gif. Anyone know about this language/company?
Formality posted a telegram group on reddit the other day: https://t.me/formality_lang

Christian Williams said:

https://galois.com/ That's a nice front page. Blake Pollard do you know people there?

I don't know anyone there personally. They have an office in Virginia, just across the Potomac from DC. I think some folks from there or who formerly worked there expressed interest in the AACT workshop, pre-COVID. I'll poke through my emails.
